availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Masters (Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of Campbell Masters and Elizabeth Masters. Married to Martha J. Masters Masters in Warren County, Kentucky, on May 22, 1855. Father of Charles C. Masters and Mary E. Masters. Carpenter in Pendleton County, Virginia, in 1850. Farmer in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Pendleton County, Franklin, p. 66A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 5.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000242961, p. 227 (accessed via ancestry.com).
